A pesar de la adversidad, Sally nunca perdió la esperanza y siempre sonrió, incluso en los momentos más difíciles. Su sonrisa era contagiosa y pronto se convirtió en la persona más querida en el pueblo. La gente venía de todas partes para verla sonreír y escuchar sus historias sobre su infancia. Su tío, aunque no lo admitiría, estaba orgulloso de ella y la apoyaba en todo lo que hacía. Sin embargo, Sally siempre se preguntaba qué hubiera sido de su vida si sus padres estuvieran vivos. ¿Habría sido feliz? ¿Habría sido una actriz famosa? ¿Habría encontrado el amor? Estas preguntas la acompañaban siempre, pero nunca las dejaba que la consumieran. En su lugar, se enfocaba en hacer de su vida lo mejor posible y en ayudar a los demás a encontrar la felicidad.

La entrada principal era una gran puerta de madera oscura, con un gran candado de hierro forjado que parecía haber sido colocado allí para detener cualquier intento de entrada no autorizada. La puerta estaba flanqueada por dos estatuas de piedra que parecían haber sido esculpidas con gran detalle, con expresiones serias y ojos que parecían seguir a cualquiera que se acercara. A medida que se caminaba hacia la entrada, el sonido de sus propias pisadas resonaba en el vacío, lo que daba la sensación de que la estructura estaba rodeada de un silencio absoluto, como si el propio tiempo hubiera sido detenido en su interior.

es_first_half: Y entonces ocurrió algo. Sentí un tirón en la boca del estómago. Oí las tuberías rugir y estremecerse. Clarisse me soltó el pelo. Un chorro de agua
es_second_half: salió disparado del váter y describió un arco perfecto por encima de mi cabeza. Yo caí de espaldas al suelo sin dejar de oír los chillidos de Clarisse.
es_results: fría me salpicó en la cara, y el ruido de las tuberías se convirtió en un rugido ensordecedor. El agua siguió saliendo a borbotones, y el olor a metal y
es_results_raw: de agua fría me salpicó en la cara, y el ruido de las tuberías se convirtió en un rugido ensordecedor. El agua siguió saliendo a borbotones, y el olor a metal y humedad se mezcló con el olor a moho y descomposición que llenaba el aire. El suelo comenzó a resbalarse bajo mis pies, y sentí que la habitación se inclinaba hacia un lado, como si el edificio mismo estuviera a punto de derrumbarse. Clarisse gritó, y su voz se perdió en el ruido de las tuberías y el rugido del agua.
tr_first_half: Sonra bir şey oldu. Midemin derinliklerinde bir şey çekildi. Su tesisatının gürlediğini, boruların zangırdadığını işittim. Clarisse saçımı çekiştirmeyi bıraktı. Tuvaletin içindeki
tr_second_half: su fırladı, tepemin üzerinde bir yay çizdi ve bir anda tuvaletin karolarının üzerinde dümdüz yatar hale geldim. Arkamdaki Clarisse çığlık çığlığaydı.
tr_results: sonunda durdu. Suyun gürlemesi durunca, Clarisse'nin yüzü bana baktı ve "Ne oldu?" diye sordu. Ben de "Bilmiyorum" dedim. O da "Bakalım" dedi ve tuvalete
tr_results_raw: sonunda durdu. Suyun gürlemesi durunca, Clarisse'nin yüzü bana baktı ve "Ne oldu?" diye sordu. Ben de "Bilmiyorum" dedim. O da "Bakalım" dedi ve tuvalete yaklaştı. Ben de arkasından gittim. Su tesisatı hâlâ gürlemeye devam ediyordu. Clarisse tuvalete yaklaştı ve suyun gürlemesini durdurdu. Sonra da bana baktı ve "Bak, ne olduğunu gördün mü?" diye sordu.

en_first_half: Word of the bathroom incident spread immediately. Wherever I went, campers pointed at me and murmured something
en_second_half: about toilet water. Or maybe they were just staring at Annabeth, who was still pretty much dripping wet.
en_results: among themselves, their whispers and snickers following me like a dark cloud, until I felt like a pariah
en_results_raw: among themselves, their whispers and snickers following me like a dark cloud, until I felt like a pariah among my own peers, and the once peaceful campsite had turned into a hostile environment, where every glance and every comment cut deep into my already fragile self-esteem.
vi_first_half: Tiếng lành đồn xa: tin về sự cố nhà vệ sinh lan toàn trại. Tôi đi đến đâu, người ta cũng chỉ
vi_second_half: trỏ và rỉ tai nhau về nước bồn cầu!! Hoặc có lẽ tôi nhầm: chắc mọi người chỉ nhìn Annabeth ướt lướt thướt.
vi_results: cập đến một sự việc tương tự. Họ nói rằng một trong những người lính đã bị mắc kẹt trong nhà vệ sinh và không
vi_results_raw: đề cập đến một sự việc tương tự. Họ nói rằng một trong những người lính đã bị mắc kẹt trong nhà vệ sinh và không thể thoát ra được. Người ta còn nói rằng tiếng kêu cứu của anh ta vẫn còn vang lên trong đêm tối, khiến cho tất cả mọi người trong trại đều sợ hãi.
es_first_half: La historia del incidente en el lavabo se extendió de inmediato. Dondequiera que iba, los campistas me
es_second_half: señalaban y murmuraban algo sobre el episodio. O puede que sólo miraran a Annabeth, que seguía bastante empapada.
es_results: preguntaban sobre el incidente, y la mayoría de ellos parecían estar al tanto de los detalles, como si hubieran estado
es_results_raw: preguntaban sobre el incidente, y la mayoría de ellos parecían estar al tanto de los detalles, como si hubieran estado allí presentes. Algunos incluso se burlaban de mí, diciendo que había sido un "desastre total" y que yo había "perdido la cabeza". Sin embargo, había algunos que parecían sentir lástima por mí, como si hubieran visto algo en mis ojos que les decía que no había sido culpa mía. Uno de ellos, un joven con un sombrero de paja y un jersey de lona, se acercó a mí y me preguntó si estaba bien, y si necesitaba algo. Su amabilidad me sorprendió, y me sentí un poco mejor, pero no mucho, porque la vergüenza y la culpa seguían pesando en mi corazón.

en_second_half: she’d catch me later. I left her on the pier, tracing her finger across the rail as if drawing a battle plan.
en_results: follow her to the food truck that was parked near the entrance of the festival, its colorful decorations and lively
en_results_raw: follow her to the food truck that was parked near the entrance of the festival, its colorful decorations and lively music drawing a crowd of hungry attendees. As I walked alongside her, the enticing aromas wafting from the truck only intensified my hunger, and I quickened my pace, my stomach growling louder with anticipation. Annabeth chuckled and playfully nudged me forward, saying that we'd get our food soon, and that I should be patient. The line was long, but the smell of sizzling burgers and hot dogs was making it hard for me to wait any longer.

I kept moving forward, and I never let that bad woman's actions define me. I'm proud of the person I became, and I'm grateful for the lessons I learned from that experience. Fue entonces cuando descubrió que mi novio había comenzado a ver a otra mujer, una mujer joven y hermosa que se llamaba Sarah. Emily se sintió aún más enojada y humillada, y su venganza se volvió cada vez más cruel. Comenzó a difamar a mi novio y a acusarlo de cosas terribles, y pronto la gente comenzó a creer en sus mentiras. Mi novio se sintió muy triste y confundido, y no sabía qué hacer para defenderse. Fue entonces cuando yo lo dejé, no porque lo hubiera hecho algo malo, sino porque no podía soportar la situación. Emily se sintió victoriosa, pero en realidad había causado más daño a sí misma que a mí. Su venganza la había consumido por completo, y había perdido a todos los que la querían. en_results: The scene was chaotic, with people running in all directions, trying to get out of the way of the frantic zebra. Maurice, still dazed from the sudden interruption, stumbled
en_results_raw: The scene was chaotic, with people running in all directions, trying to get out of the way of the frantic zebra. Maurice, still dazed from the sudden interruption, stumbled backward, tripping over his own feet as he desperately tried to regain his balance. The zebra, now in the middle of the street, was causing a massive traffic jam, with cars screeching to a halt and drivers leaping out of their vehicles to try and catch the escaped animal. Meanwhile, the sound of sirens could be heard in the distance, growing louder by the second, as the authorities were alerted to the situation. The air was filled with the smell of burnt rubber and the sound of horns blaring, creating a cacophony of chaos that seemed to have no end in sight. As the situation continued to spiral out of control, it became clear that this was going to be a very long and eventful day.

en_second_half: or two letters were floating around. The more I thought about my quest, the more I was sure that confronting Hades wasn’t the real answer. There was something else going on, something even more dangerous.

en_results_raw: remembered a crucial letter or a slight variation in spelling that would suddenly make it clear. It was as if my brain was trying to recall a forgotten melody, and the more I tried to force it, the more elusive it became. Ông ta biết rằng những linh hồn này không chỉ đơn thuần là những linh hồn bị giam cầm, mà còn là những người đã từng sống, từng yêu thương, từng khóc lóc và từng đau đớn. Và trong ánh mắt của Hades, có một sự tự trách móc, vì đã không thể cứu được họ, không thể giúp họ thoát khỏi sự giam cầm của bóng tối.

en_second_half: out that my most powerful weapon of fear is missing. So I searched for you myself, and when it was clear you were coming to me to deliver your threat, I did not try to stop you.”
en_results: out that I have been so reckless as to lose control of the helm, but I fear that it may already be the case. The Fates themselves may be against me, and I am left to face the consequences
en_results_raw: out that I have been so reckless as to lose control of the helm, but I fear that it may already be the case. The Fates themselves may be against me, and I am left to face the consequences of my own hubris. The weight of my responsibilities as Lord of the Underworld is crushing me, and I fear that I may not be able to bear it for much longer. The whispers of the mortals, the pleas of the damned, the endless procession of souls - it is a burden that I can hardly bear, and I am starting to wonder if I am truly fit for this role. The thought of being overthrown by one of my own kind, or worse, by a mortal, is a prospect that fills me with dread. I must find a way to regain control of the helm, or risk losing everything that I hold dear.

en_first_half: “You didn’t order the theft,” I guessed. “Someone else sent a hero to steal the two items. Then, when Zeus sent you to hunt him down, you caught the thief. But you didn’t turn
en_second_half: him over to Zeus. Something convinced you to let him go. You kept the items until another hero could come along and complete the delivery. That thing in the pit is ordering you around.”
en_results: The items over to the authorities, because you were in on the whole operation from the beginning. You were the one who had orchestrated the entire heist, and Zeus was just a pawn in your
en_results_raw: The items over to the authorities, because you were in on the whole operation from the beginning. You were the one who had orchestrated the entire heist, and Zeus was just a pawn in your game. But why would you do such a thing? What could you possibly gain from stealing two seemingly insignificant items? And what was the true purpose behind your actions? Was it a test of some sort, or was it something more sinister? The more I thought about it, the more questions I had, and the more I realized that I was in over my head. I decided to dig deeper, to uncover the truth behind the theft and the mysterious figure behind it all. I began by questioning the other gods, trying to see if anyone had any information about the events that had transpired. But they all seemed just as clueless as I was, and I was starting to feel like I was on my own in this investigation. I knew I had to be careful, though, because if I was right, and you were the mastermind behind the theft, then you would stop at nothing to keep your secret safe. I had to tread carefully, but I was determined to get to the bottom of this mystery, no matter what it took.

Pero una cosa es segura: el destino de los dioses es un misterio que solo ellos conocen, y nosotros somos solo mortales, condenados a adivinar y a especular sobre sus planes y decisiones. Pero, ¿qué hay de ti, amigo mío? ¿Qué papel crees que jugaste en esta historia, y qué crees que es el verdadero propósito de Zeus al enviarte en esta misión? ¿Es posible que seas más que un simple mortal, y que tengas un papel más importante que el que parece ser en la superficie? Estas preguntas, amigo mío, son las que me hacen reflexionar sobre la naturaleza de la realidad y la intervención divina en nuestras vidas.

en_first_half: Poor little Percy Jackson wasn’t an international criminal after all. He’d caused a commotion on that Greyhound bus in New Jersey trying to get away from his captor (and afterward, witnesses would even swear they had seen the leather-clad man on the bus-“Why didn’t I remember him before?”). The crazy man had caused the explosion in the St. Louis Arch. After all, no kid could’ve done that. A concerned waitress in Denver had seen the man threatening his abductees
en_second_half: outside her diner, gotten a friend to take a photo, and notified the police. Finally, brave Percy Jackson (I was beginning to like this kid) had stolen a gun from his captor in Los Angeles and battled him shotgun-to-rifle on the beach. Police had arrived just in time. But in the spectacular explosion, five police cars had been destroyed and the captor had fled. No fatalities had occurred. Percy Jackson and his two friends were safely in police custody.

As the investigation continued, the agents began to uncover a web of deceit and corruption that went all the way to the top, and they realized that they had stumbled upon something much bigger than a simple kidnapping case. The truth was far more sinister, and it would take a team of experts to unravel the threads of this complex conspiracy. But for now, the only clue was a cryptic message scrawled on a napkin in a diner in Kansas: "The boy is not what he seems."

es_first_half: Después de todo, el pobrecito Percy Jackson no era un criminal internacional. Había causado un buen revuelo en el autobús Greyhound de Nueva Jersey al intentar escapar de su captor (a posteriori hubo testigos que aseguraron haber visto al hombre vestido de cuero en el autobús: «¿Por qué no lo recordé antes?»). El psicópata había provocado la explosión en el arco de San Luis; ningún chaval habría podido hacer algo así. Una camarera de Denver había visto al hombre amenazar a sus secuestrados delante de su restaurante,
es_second_half: había pedido a un amigo que tomara una foto y lo había notificado a la policía. Al final, el valiente Percy Jackson (empezaba a gustarme aquel chaval) se había hecho con un arma de su captor en Los Ángeles y se había enfrentado a él en la playa. La policía había llegado a tiempo. Pero en la espectacular explosión cinco coches de policía habían resultado destruidos y el secuestrador había huido. No había habido bajas. Percy Jackson y sus dos amigos estaban a salvo bajo custodia policial.
es_results: pero no había nada en su comportamiento que sugiriera que fuera un asesino en serie. El caso era que Percy Jackson era un chico normal, con un pasado normal, que había sido arrastrado a un mundo de misterio y peligro. Pero ¿qué había detrás de todo esto? ¿Qué había detrás de la explosión en el arco de San Luis? ¿Y qué había detrás de la amenaza que había hecho en el restaurante de Denver? La policía no tenía ni idea, pero estaba claro que Percy Jackson no era el único que estaba en peligro.
es_results_raw: pero no había nada en su comportamiento que sugiriera que fuera un asesino en serie. El caso era que Percy Jackson era un chico normal, con un pasado normal, que había sido arrastrado a un mundo de misterio y peligro. Pero ¿qué había detrás de todo esto? ¿Qué había detrás de la explosión en el arco de San Luis? ¿Y qué había detrás de la amenaza que había hecho en el restaurante de Denver? La policía no tenía ni idea, pero estaba claro que Percy Jackson no era el único que estaba en peligro. Había algo más en juego, algo que involucraba a personas y organizaciones que no querían que la verdad saliera a la luz. Y Percy, con su inocente apariencia de chico de dieciséis años, se había convertido en el centro de todo esto. Mientras tanto, en el mundo de los dioses, Ares, el dios de la guerra, observaba con interés la situación, sabiendo que la lucha entre los dioses y los mortales estaba a punto de comenzar. La guerra de los titanes había sido un preludio, pero esta vez, la batalla sería en la tierra, y Percy Jackson sería el principal protagonista. La pregunta era, ¿sería capaz de sobrevivir? La respuesta solo la conocía el destino.

en_results_raw: The dummies apart with a ferocity that left me wondering if he was trying to win a prize or just venting his frustrations. The sound of clashing steel echoed through the empty arena, and I couldn't help but feel a mix of admiration and concern for my friend's well-being. His movements were fluid, almost dance-like, as he spun and parried with the sword, but I knew that in a real fight, those fancy moves wouldn't be enough to save him. I decided to observe from a safe distance, not wanting to distract him from his training, and took a moment to study the sword more closely. It was indeed a beautiful piece of craftsmanship, with intricate engravings along the blade and a worn leather grip that seemed to fit Luke's hand perfectly. I wondered where he'd gotten it and what kind of training he'd received to wield it so skillfully. As I watched, Luke's movements became more aggressive, his breathing more labored, and I knew he was pushing himself to his limits. I just hoped he wouldn't push himself too far, or he might end up getting hurt. The thought sent a shiver down my spine, and I found myself wishing I could join him in the arena, to help him train and keep him safe. But I knew that would only be a distraction, and Luke needed to focus on his craft if he wanted to become the best swordsman he could be.
